compute.panel.qte

compute.panel.qte uses third period of data, combined with Distributional Difference in Differences assumption (Fan and Yu, 2012) to point identify QTET.

compute.panel.qtet(formla, xformla = NULL, t, tmin1, tmin2, tname, x = NULL,
  data, dropalwaystreated = TRUE, idname, probs = seq(0.05, 0.95, 0.05),
  bootstrap.iter = FALSE, plot = FALSE, method = c("logit", "GMM",
  "semiparametric", "simulation", "direct"), ydiscrete = FALSE)

Arguments

formla
outcome variable on treatment
t
last time period
tmin1
middle time period
tmin2
initial time period
x
additional covariates if using propensity score reweighting technique
dropalwaystreated
boolean indicating whether in true panel data context (when treatment can occur in any period) whether or not previously treated observations should be dropped from the sample. This functionality is not currently implemented
idname
an id that identifies individual units over time
probs
the values at which the quantile treatment effects should be computed
bootstrap.iter
boolean passed that is passed in when this method is used to compute standard errors
plot
Binary indicating whether or not to plot the object
method
How to estimate the propensity score
ydiscrete
Used to indicate whether the outcome has any discrete parts in the distribution

Value

QTE object

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
